content:
KUALA LUMPUR (March 13): Prolintas Infra Business Trust on Wednesday fixed the final price of its initial public offering (IPO) at 95 sen per unit, unchanged from the initial price set, valuing the highway concession owner at RM1.05 billion.

title: Challenges of women in informal employment
summary: In the “Informal Employment in Malaysia: Trends, Challenges and Opportunities for Reform” report by the World Bank in February, a data analysis of the informal employment landscape in Malaysia reveals the vulnerabilities of those in it. Household income surveys conducted between 2009 and 2019 show that women, youth, less educated persons and workers from lower-income households, rural areas and less developed states were more likely to be informally employed. In fact, women across groups were more likely to experience skill-related unemployment, which is defined as the share of those with tertiary education working in mid- or low-skilled jobs in the workforce.
